The phrase: no two snowflakes are exactly alike" is a commonly repeated truism that sparks wonder in children.
At the visual level: with expensive laboratory equipment, it is possible to create snowflakes that look almost identical.
At the molecular level: the chance of two identical snowflakes is extremely low and considered impossible due to the complex crystallization processes involved.
The shape and characteristics of a snowf: as well as the changing temperatures and humidities it encounters.
